title: Definition of Observer Pattern
content: What is the Observer Pattern and why is it useful in JavaScript applications?
sampleAnswers: The Observer Pattern allows objects (observers) to subscribe to another object (observable) so they get notified when events occur.
Itâ€™s useful because it enables decoupling and supports event-driven programming.

title: Core Components of Observer Pattern
content: Which three components are essential in the Observer Pattern implementation?

title: Observer Pattern in React
content: In the example provided, which functions act as observers when subscribed to the observable?

title: Observable Notifications
content: What happens when the observable's notify() method is called?
sampleAnswers: It loops through the observers list and invokes each subscribed function with the provided data.
All observers receive the event data at the same time.

title: Practical Use Case
content: Which scenario is a good use case for the Observer Pattern?

options.text: Notifying multiple UI components when new messages arrive
Rendering static content with no user interaction

title: Observer Pattern vs Pub/Sub
content: What is the key difference between the Observer Pattern and the Publish/Subscribe (Pub/Sub) pattern?
sampleAnswers: In Observer, observers subscribe directly to the observable, creating tight coupling.
In Pub/Sub, a mediator (event bus) manages communication, decoupling publishers and subscribers.

title: Observer Pattern in RxJS
content: Which popular JavaScript library uses the Observer Pattern extensively?

title: Performance Concern
content: What is one potential drawback of the Observer Pattern?

options.text: Observers cannot be removed once added
Too many or complex observers can cause performance issues during notifications
Observable cannot notify multiple observers at once
It cannot work with asynchronous data
